{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sealer penetration into dentinal tubules is a crucial step in endodontic treatment. The type of sealer used can influence the penetration depth, as different sealers have different physical and chemical properties. The method of obturation can also affect sealer penetration, as different techniques can lead to different degrees of sealer penetration. However, between the two, the type of sealer used is more directly related to its ability to penetrate dentinal tubules.", "answer_choice": "A"}
